definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Retaliation only escalates a bully's aggression.
sentences.chinese: 报复只会升高施霸凌者的侵犯气焰。

sentences.english: It seems the growth of its arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎滋长了它的嚣张气焰。

sentences.english: After Sir Thomas comes back, he tries to control the Crawfords' force.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯爵士归来后，对克劳福特的气焰有所压制。

sentences.english: We must take  that guy down a bit.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须压压那个家伙的气焰。

sentences.english: His power was so great that the people present had to swallow their anger.
sentences.chinese: 他炽灼的气焰让在座的人敢怒而不敢言。

sentences.english: A known element, um say a piece of iron for example, is heated in the(a) pure gas flame.
sentences.chinese: 一种已知的元素，例如一片铁在纯气焰上进行加热。

sentences.english: Do not have via confirming a seat later by accident, man still be foul-mouthed , arrogance aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 经后来确认座位无误，男子仍骂骂咧咧，气焰嚣张。

sentences.english: This is the essential of the arrogance.
sentences.chinese: 这是必不可少的嚣张气焰。

sentences.english: I'm taking it slow, feeding my flame, shuffling the cards of your game.
sentences.chinese: 我不紧不慢，助长气焰，为你游戏洗牌准备。

sentences.english: But rumors of his arrogance anger him.
sentences.chinese: 但是传闻他的愤怒他的嚣张气焰。

sentences.english: The flames of Pearl Harbor, the Japanese aggressors more aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 珍珠港事件爆发，日寇的气焰更加嚣张。

definition: to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
